questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Greece is known for its remarkably preserved multi-tiered amphitheater, dating back to the Hellenistic period?
questions.context: Situated in the northeastern part of the Peloponnese, this site was a pilgrimage center dedicated to the healing god Asclepius.

questions.question: Where is the space exploration site located, from which the historic launch of the first human-made satellite into space occurred?
questions.context: On October 4, 1957, Sputnik 1 was launched from this site, marking the beginning of the space age and sparking the space race.

questions.question: What is the site of the infamous battle in Belgium, known for Napoleon's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: This battle site saw Napoleon Bonaparte's forces defeated by the Duke of Wellington and his allies, marking the end of the Napoleonic Wars.

questions.question: Identify the UNESCO World Heritage Site in Italy famous for its well-preserved ancient ruins buried by a volcanic eruption in AD 79.
questions.context: The eruption of Mount Vesuvius buried this city under meters of volcanic ash, preserving buildings, artifacts, and human forms.

questions.question: Which museum in France is housed in a former royal palace and is renowned for its vast collection, including the Mona Lisa?
questions.context: Located in Paris, this museum is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument, attracting millions of visitors annually.
